a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The burden of disease vs. GDP per capita, 2019
The burden of disease is measured in Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALYs). DALYs measure the total burden of
disease â€“ both from years of life lost due to premature death and years lived with a disability.
One DALY equals one lost year of healthy life. Here it is age-standardized and expressed per 100,000 individuals.
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2019); Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
